result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricki A. Hankins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 15CF51, but consecutive to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF51.

records.addlTxt: (Restitution added and put onto correct case 15CF71)

2:04 p.m. Defendant Ricki A. Hankins in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Ricki A. Hankins in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF51 and 15CF71. Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report. Victim(s) were notified of today's hearing and not present today. Atty Drengler states a correction to the PSI. Court takes note of the correction. ADA Knaapen makes sentencing recommendation of 30 months prison, consecutive to each other. Atty Drengler makes sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes apologetic statements. 

By The Court:***Prison****
15CF51 5yrs prison 2 yrs Incarceration & 3 yrs Extended Supervision , consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to 15CF71, 
Not eligible for challenge or substance abuse programs 
Conditions:
NO contact CKarch or AJR their residences, their immediate families or employment, unless approved by the Dept/Agent.
NO checks or checking account unless approved by agent, prior permission needed.
Complete an ADOA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Complete a psychological assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases to show compliance
Comply with a domestic abuse assessment and comply with recommended treatments.
Comply with budget counseling.
Comply with another assessments, treatments, and prgramming deemed appropriate by Agent.
Restitution $565 to C. Karch. Up to 50% prison account.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
Obtain/Maintin employment until financial obligations, then can obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
  Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.

15CF71 5yrs prison 2 yrs in & 3 yrs ES , current with 15CF51, but consecutive to any other sentence.
Not eligible for challenge or substance abuse programs.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ricki A. Hankins in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Ricki A. Hankins in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-51 and 15CF-71.

2:18 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is an agreement.

15CF-51:
Defendant will plead to Count 1 as charged.
Count 2 and Count 3 would be dismissed and read in.
Parties anticipate a PSI. 
State caps recommendation at 30 months prison sentence, consecutive, defense free to argue.

15CF-71:
Defendant will plead to Count 1 as charged.
Count 2 would be dismissed and read in.
Parties anticipate a PSI.
State caps recommendation at 30 months prison sentence, consecutive, defense free to argue.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 15CF-51 Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-71 Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Defendant agrees with previous convictions.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Atty Drengler has provided all plea bargins offered by the State, to his client.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-51: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-51: Count 2 and Count 3: Dismissed and read in
15CF-71: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-71: Count 2: Dismissed and read in

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Court will order a PSI.

State requests bond revoked in both cases.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is ordered revoked (in both cases).

PSI to be completed by the end of August, by August 31st at the latest.
Copies to be forwarded to counsel.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
